Sequence Information.Function: Probably participates in a plant defense mechanism. Has antibiotic activity. Inhibits the cytopathic effects and replication of the human immunodeficiency virus. Active against both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.

Literature.Title: Circulins A and B: novel HIV-inhibitor macrocyclic peptide from tropical tree Chassalia parvifolia.
Literature.Author: Kashman Y.,Parson I.C.,Henderson L.E.,Sowder R.C. II,Gustafson K.R.

Literature.Title: Analysis of the disulfide linkage pattern in circulin A and B, HIV-inhibitory macrocyclic peptides.
Literature.Author: Pannell L.K.,Gustafson K.R.,Derua R.

Literature.Title: An unusual structural motif of antimicrobial peptides containing end-to-end macrocycle and cystine-knot disulfides.
Literature.Author: Chiu K.-W.,Yang J.-L.,Lu Y.-A.,Tam J.P.

Literature.Title: Structure of circulin B and implications for antimicrobial activity of the cyclotides.
Literature.Author: Craik D.J.,Gustafson K.R.,Daly N.L.,Koltay A.
